sledgehammer.plugin

Class Module

  • java.lang.Object
    • sledgehammer.util.Printable
      • sledgehammer.plugin.Module
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ModuleCore, ModuleNPC, ModuleVanilla, MongoModule, SQLiteModule

    public abstract class Module
extends Printable
    Class to handle module operations and utilities.
    Author:
    Jab

      • createChatChannel

        public ChatChannel createChatChannel(java.lang.String name)
        Registers a ChatChannel with no description or permission-node. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the name provided is null or empty.
        Parameters:
        name - The String name of the ChatChannel.
        Returns:
        Returns the result ChatChannel.

      • createChatChannel

        public ChatChannel createChatChannel(java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.String description,
                                     java.lang.String permissionNode)
        Registers a ChatChannel with a name, description, and permission-node to access it. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the name provided is null or empty.

        The ChatChannel is set to be global, public, not custom, saves history, and allows Players to speak.

        Parameters:
        name - The String name of the ChatChannel.
        description - The String description of the ChatChannel.
        permissionNode - The String permission-node of the ChatChannel.
        Returns:
        Returns the result ChatChannel.

      • createChatChannel

        public ChatChannel createChatChannel(java.lang.String channelName,
                                     java.lang.String channelDescription,
                                     java.lang.String permissionNode,
                                     boolean isGlobalChannel,
                                     boolean isPublicChannel,
                                     boolean isCustomChannel,
                                     boolean saveHistory,
                                     boolean canSpeak)
        Registers a ChatChannel with a name, description, permission-node, and all flags associated with it.
        Parameters:
        channelName - The String name of the ChatChannel.
        channelDescription - The String description of the ChatChannel.
        permissionNode - The String permission-node of the ChatChannel.
        isGlobalChannel - Flag for if the ChatChannel should send messages to all players, or players relative to their location.
        isPublicChannel - Flag for if the ChatChannel is public to all Players, or if the ChatChannel is only accessible to the Player's with the given permission-node.
        isCustomChannel - Flag for if the ChatChannel is a custom ChatChannel. (Has no use)
        saveHistory - Flag to save the history of the ChatChannel.
        canSpeak - Flag for if the Players are allowed to send Messages in the ChatChannel. (Read-Only if set to false)
        Returns:
        Returns the result ChatChannel.

      • unregisterChatChannel

        public void unregisterChatChannel(ChatChannel chatChannel)
        Unregisters a given ChatChannel.
        Parameters:
        chatChannel - The ChatChannel being unregistered.

        Returns:

      • isLuaOverriden

        public boolean isLuaOverriden()
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Settings allow Lua files to be modified by anything other than the Modules that saves the Lua Files. Returns false if ONLY the Modules have rights to the final versions of Lua files.

      • saveResource

        public void saveResource(java.lang.String path)
        Saves a File resource stored in the Plug-in Jar File to the same location inside the Module's data folder. If the File exists in that location, the File is not overwritten.
        Parameters:
        path - The String path to the File inside the Jar file.

      • saveResource

        public void saveResource(java.lang.String path,
                         boolean overwrite)
        Saves a File resource stored in the Plug-in Jar File to the same location inside the Module's data folder. If the file exists in that location and overwrite is set to false, the File is not overwritten.
        Parameters:
        path - The String path to the File inside the Jar File.
        overwrite - Flag to set if the File is to be overwritten, regardless of it's state.

      • saveResourceAs

        public void saveResourceAs(java.lang.String jarPath,
                           java.lang.String destPath)
        Saves a File resource stored in the Plug-in Jar file to the given destination inside the Module's data folder. If the file exists in the destination, the File is not overwritten.
        Parameters:
        jarPath - The String path to the File inside the Jar File.
        destPath - The String destination path to the File stored inside the Module's data folder.

      • saveResourceAs

        public void saveResourceAs(java.lang.String jarPath,
                           java.lang.String destPath,
                           boolean overwrite)
        Saves a File resource stored in the Plug-in Jar file to the given destination inside the Module's data folder. If the file exists in that location and overwrite is set to false, the File is not overwritten.
        Parameters:
        jarPath - The String path to the File inside the Jar File.
        destPath - The String destination path to the File stored inside the Module's data folder.
        overwrite - Flag to set if the File is to be overwritten, regardless of it's state.

      • saveResourceAs

        public void saveResourceAs(java.lang.String jarPath,
                           java.io.File absolutePath,
                           boolean overwrite)
        Saves a File resource stored in the Plug-in Jar file to the absolute File path provided.. If the File exists in the location given and overwrite is set to false, the File will not be saved.
        Parameters:
        jarPath - The String path to the File inside the Jar File.
        absolutePath - The absolute File location to save the file. (This is not a directory, but a full file path)
        overwrite - Flag to set if the File is to be overwritten, regardless of it's state.

      • setPermissionListener

        public void setPermissionListener(PermissionListener permissionListener)
        Sets the Sledgehammer engine's PermissionListener. This method is reserved for the Plug-ins implementing a permissions solution.
        Parameters:
        permissionListener - The PermissionListener to set.

      • addDefaultPermission

        public void addDefaultPermission(java.lang.String node)
        Approximate Method to 'SledgeHammer.instance.addDefaultPermission(node)'.

        Adds a String permission-node to the default PermissionGroup, allowing all Players to be granted the permission-node.

        Parameters:
        node - The String node to add.

      • addDefaultPermission

        public void addDefaultPermission(java.lang.String node,
                                 boolean flag)
        Approximate Method to 'SledgeHammer.instance.addDefaultPermission(node)'.

        Adds a String permission-node to the default PermissionGroup with a given Boolean flag. All PermissionUsers with a specific definition will override this.

        Parameters:
        node - The String node to add.
        flag - The Boolean flag to set.

      • handleEvent

        public void handleEvent(Event event,
                        boolean shouldLog)
        Approximate method for 'SledgeHammer.instance.handle(event, shouldLog)'.

        Handles a Event, passing it to all registered EventListeners listening for the Event's type.

        Parameters:
        event - The Event to handle.
        shouldLog - Flag for whether or not to pass the Event to the registered LogListeners as a LogEvent, based on the data set in the Event.

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(java.lang.String type,
                           java.lang.String context)
        Used to execute GenericEvent commands. This will be picked up by modules that @override this this method.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of event.
        context - The context of the event.

      • onBuildLua

        public void onBuildLua(SendLua send)
        Fired when building the Lua to send to a Player.

        This allows each Module to choose what to send to the Player. This means that while regular Players receive code for most functions, advanced Players may get more code to do more things.

        Parameters:
        send -
